caption: Best service and very good food experience. It's great but just a touch under the other world renown spots.

There are also three wine pairing options: Sommelier’s Pairing (we did this one on the previous visit), Spanish Pairing (we also did this one previously) and Chef’s Pairing, which is the most expensive option, and mostly poured via Coravin. We did the Spanish and the Chef’s Pairing this visit, and were greatly rewarded - while not inexpensive

There are also three wine pairing options: Sommelier’s Pairing (we did this one on the previous visit), Spanish Pairing (we also did this one previously) and Chef’s Pairing, which is the most expensive option, and mostly poured via Coravin. We did the Spanish and the Chef’s Pairing this visit, and were greatly rewarded
Chef Ruben Mosquero does not disappoint!  Cocktails on point.
It's been exquisite experience, superior, best in it's class, the highest quality!
Quality Meals and the scene at this place is excellent. this place does it for me. certainly worth a return trip. prices were appropriate.
Went with friends. It's not worth the price and they nickel and dime you. Service is super friendly.

I love mini bar I was there to celebrate my 50th birthday  very memorable from the beginning to end.  Dish after Dish. Awesome wine. I can’t wait to go back if the world ever comes back to normal  !!!!
Fantastically amazing food!
Amazing. Decor is great. Wonderful to interact with chefs during dining experience. I think I would opt for counter over the 'Jose's Table.' Bar Mini was an experience as well.

Second time here and it was a treat.  The real standouts was the lobster and duck egg, and the forest floor mushroom dish.   A great example of how modern gastronomy can bring together flavors texture and temperatures that traditionally cooked food can not.
Worth the price!  Sometimes you just need experience something truly amazing in food. This is the place!
Favorite restaurant in DC!
Unsurprisingly amazing. Food was outstanding. Even the dishes I didn't adore were great. The staff changed it from a meal to an experience. 15/10 across the board.
One of the few authentic creative restaurants in the world.
Minibar is an absolutely amazing experience that you should try if you have a chance. It is more of a combination of art and science than a meal.

Great experience whether dining solo or in a group. Plenty of molecular gastronomy techniques, although the flavor combinations are not very challenging. Staff are very professional, although I felt service was a little too choreographed and could probably be a little more off the cuff. Probably fairly unique on the East Coast, as not many places these days are as explicitly technique-focused.
AMAZING experience in all respects. A must do!

The chefs and waitstaff are genuinely interested in making your experience as entertaining, transformative, and effortless as possible. Don't be afraid to ask the chefs questions; the food and their stories are so interesting, you'll be sorry if you don't.

Amazing food and totally fantastic experience, service is totally on point and elevates the dining experience overall. The wine pairings were perfect and really liked some if the playful elements like the bahn mi that looks like is served on roll but is actually made of apple, the chicharron that has no pork, etc.

Amazing experience.  From the tour of the kitchen when you first arrive to the expertise shown in cooking and wines.  All questions answered with a smile and details.  Passionate people who love their jobs are a pleasure to be with.

Best restaurant I have ever been to. It’s very expensive so I have only been once. But been to the bar part 2x. Amazing molecular gastronomy techniques. I hope to go again soon. They served me 30 amazing courses on my 23rd bday.

What an amazing experience !  Dishes created and presented in ways one never imagined.  Sweet, savory, distinctive and unique.  Not a cheap date, but save up your ducks and go once.  You won't be sorry!

Gloriously posh and creative, minibar is a lovely experience, BUT something is missing that would rank it as my top fine dining destination. Do not get me wrong, I am glad I went, and if you are a food enthusiast with the cash to spare, it is worth a trip at least once. However, I would not necessarily go back to minibar when there are so many other highly rated restaurants in the DC area to try. Many of the snack sized dishes are innovative, fun AND delicious. My fav was the Beet Pizzelle with Ostera Caviar - perfect combo of earthy, crisp, salty, and creamy that explored both texture and flavor. The use of an alpine cheese that I could eat buckets of was also appreciated in several of the snacks. But overuse of white truffle frankly clouded a few dishes that would have been perfectly fine without the cloying shavings. Don’t get me wrong, I like me some truffle, but in the Unagi Salmorejo, it took away from the ocean-y brine of the sea urchin. I think truffle gets overused in a lot of fine dining settings as an expensive “wow” factor - this was definitely the case with minibar. The gelatinous “beans” of concentrated flavor were used several times, and while at first I was really  impressed, it started to get old. The “Gigante Bean” was my least favorite snack, as it overplayed the novelty of the wiggly bean of concentrated flavor and basically are out tasting like a weird blob of bacon fat. In comparison, the following snack of Panceta Iberico and Ostera Caviar nailed the flavor combo of pork fat and salt in a more traditional presentation. Food aside, the service is fantastic. The orchestration of presenting dishes was spot on, not too performance-y, just the right amount of elegant presentation to augment the dishes. The staff is all young, attractive, and have great skin. Seriously, what toner do you all use? Capping off the evening at barmini is fun and more social that the intimate setting of minibar. It’s worth going light on the drinks during dinner so you can end the evening with one of the many delectable drinks at barmini. If anything, I would probably seek to go to barmini again over minibar.
It was an amazing experience.  Food was delicious , service was excellent.

My girlfriend and I are just visiting DC and decided to treat ourselves. This was the best dinner either of us have ever had by far, while the entire staff deserve nothing but praise I felt it was necessary to make a special mention of jaleesa who was nothing but wonderful and really topped off a wonderful experience.
So good. They bring in other senses as part of the experience, which was cool.

Top 2 or 3 of all the Michelin star restaurants I've been to. Every course was well crafted, both delicious and surprising. I can say the meal was whimsical with a straight face. Definitely worth the money. I'll be going back.

Drinks and snacks phenomenal...when in DC if you want to have a supreme libation, I highly recommend. Customers service superb, staff seasoned attentive professionals. Will definitely return, perfect first visit and snacks tasty too.. I had the salmon tartar and got to taste the olives which had a jelly liquid base very interesting almost magical as they melt in your mouth and the grilled cheese delicious and buttery 😋. Go, see, try and taste.
Love love this place!! Great for Date nites! .. so intimate!
wow 5 start gourmet experience

Such an awesome experience! By far one of the best restaurants in D.C... The only thing is I wouldn’t gave gotten the wine pairing if I had known what I’d be served. Only one red, fairly sweet whites for my palate, and the pours were more of a tasting than a pairing. The food and service were impeccable though. Thank you Minibar chefs and José Andrés!

Had an amazing dinner at this 2-Michelin star restaurant. It is very expensive, but no doubt worth the cost for the incredible experience. If you want a fine-dining experience in Washington, DC, this is an absolute must.
An amazing and surprisingly fun experience! Highly recommend for a special occasion.
Superlative in every way
Incredible meal here. Number one restaurant in DC is well deserved. Max, John, Jorge and all the other chefs put on a fantastic display and the food is spectacular.
The choreography of presenting the food is swift, delicate yet deliberate.
Perfection.  Food and service.
A ridiculously amazing dining experience..please go!! No one will regret it!!!

One of the great food experiences in DC. We took a friend who's an executive chef at a fine restaurant and he was similarly blown away. Olives which melted in your mouth. Soy sauce "pig ears" which disappear after the first hearty crunch. Surprises at every turn, and a team in the kitchen working at the top of their game. I wish I'd taken more pictures but the disembodied hand drink will have to do!
Awesome experience!
Top place to visit in DC

Delicious bites with great wine pairing. Each dish is explained thoroughly and presented beautifully too you. Service is above par and they never allow your water glass to be empty. After dinner head over to barmini for a tasty cocktail.
One of the best experiences of my life!
An adventure unlike any in DC. The best seasonal ingredients taken to a new level and classics deconstructed. My husband wasn't full by the end of the meal, but I was.
Unbelievable, memorable dining experience of a lifetime
Amazing food and service. Intimidating bathroom.
Exquisite experience, and although expensive, totally worth it.

Exceptional! I am not even sure there are words that will let me explain this experience.  It truly is a once in a lifetime must do.  The food was out of this world and the service (although maybe a little too much) was also exceptional.  Yes it is pricey, but for that once in a lifetime treat it is definitely worth it.  The surprises and delights just kept coming!!!

A whole different world of food. It's hard to say whether or not it was worth the money as I graciously had my meal paid for, but it places you basically on the frontier of what is possible with food. Admittedly, in the 20 odd course tasting menu there were some duds, but the courses that worked were earth shatteringly flavorful and changed my perception of what food can be.  I would recommend getting the wine pairing even if you don't drink, the wines are incredible and if you don't drink they serve you non alcoholic mock tails made from fresh juices that were a flavor experience unto itself, the pairings are by far the most clever aspect of an incredibly clever meal.
My single favorite restaurant in the world ! Chefs counter , amazing food, wine and the best service !!!
A memorable culinary experience second to none! The food is whimsical and full of flavor and the pairings were almost perfect. If you like Michelin star dining, highly recommended.
Incredible drinks, presentation, and service

A culinary tour de force, exquisite technique and brilliant creativity combine with ambiance and service to produce one of the most rewarding meals I've ever experienced. Some of the dishes are so surprising and delightful that I laughed out loud. The staff was welcoming, warm, and informative; their passion and attention to detail was inspiring.
Unlike any other dining experience you will ever have. Each course is a new adventure. Inventive at every turn. Our second time. We will be back.
Definitely the best place to eat in DC! Service and food were incredible with many little surprises that really make it worth the money!

(Translated by Google) A unique experience. If you are visiting DC, it is a mandatory place to go. All delicious and delicious  (Original) Una experiencia única. Si estás de visita en DC, es un lugar obligatorio para ir.  Todo exquisito y delicioso
Victor and Christina provided amazing service. The chefs provided amazing food. So many dishes!

I feel another reviewer here said it best: "The food was overly complicated for the sake of being complicated... Minibar takes the food out of the art."  While Minibar was in terms of experience, atmosphere, presentation, service, and such on par with other molecular gastronomy establishments I've enjoyed greatly - simply said, I did not find the food very delicious.  Expect to lay out $1,200 for two with drinks. Single glasses of wine run $40.
Amazing experience.  Thank you all.
Amazing is cutting it short.
Place sucks
There are no words that can do this experience justice. It was amazing and each dish was better than I thought it could be!
Always fabulous!
Great service, drinks, and atmosphere
Amazing
Completely over the top

The price is unquestionably prohibitive for a lit of people, but if you can afford it without worrying too much, the experience is well worth it. Everything was beautiful and delicious and the staff is delightful, when they have a moment to chat in between all the delicate little courses. The wine pairing is arguably less worth the cost, so we share one wine pairing (all amazing vintages) and one non- alcoholic 'virtue' pairing which was arguably more interesting. If I go back it will not be for some time, but I do not regret the experience.
What an absolute incredible experience. The staff was wonderful and the food was delicious.
It was worth it

minibar offers the full value tasting experience and well deserves its Michelin rating.  Dishes run the gambit from familiar to obscure, but all are delicious.  Arrive expecting to try something new, something reimagined, and something familiar.  The service is the best I've experienced at any restaurant worldwide.  An experience of a lifetime.
Love it ❤️
A great experience, creatives and very tasty food. Service is great, but sometimes almost a little overdone (people hovering behind me). Excited to see what the renovation brings.
Totally amazing, next level experience. A destination, not an everyday restaurant.
Really amazing menu and experience.
So good.

It’s was a fantastic and very expensive experience. I think it’s the kind of place where you want to go once, try the crazy textures and enjoy the culinary chemistry class. In my opinion you don’t need to go and try it every season, the fun part is the textures and molecular cuisine.

What can you say? If you want to have a food memory this should be on your bucket list. It is theater with food, the chefs, the servers, and you as the stars. It is completely immersive and every bite (about 30 total) is careful composed of the best flavors and finest ingredients. It is costly but once you experience it you will understand why.
The premier dining experience in Washington, DC. (Emphasis on period)
Amazing experience.
An experience of a lifetime. Surprises at every turn. Should have been awarded their 3rd Michelin star, imho! Maybe this year.
AMAZING!!! This is a must indulgence for true foodies.  Best meal I have ever had.

(Translated by Google) One of the best culinary experiences I have ever had.  The menu is excellent and the experience phenomenal. You feel like you're in an episode of Chefs Table.  (Original) Una de las mejores experiencias culinarias que haya tenido.  El menú es excelente y la experiencia fenomenal . Te sientes en un episodio de Chefs Table.
(Translated by Google) Beautiful place for the imagination to fly and the senses to explode .. !!  (Original) Hermoso lugar para que la imaginacion vuele y los sentidos estallen..!!
Great fun with food. Super hospitable. Perfect experience.
Incredible food experience.

How is it possible that this place has only 2 Michelin stars?  You pay for the experience of eating creative and delicious food.  Sure someone said the food was over processed, but it was to bring out the flavors of the ingredients.  Loved the open kitchen and seeing all the chefs working together in harmony and letting your pallet be surprised.
All my experience met the standard and was very happy with the food selection

It was a fun and exciting dining experience. However, to be honest, every course was too processed, too gelatinous, too liquified and too much of a departure from fresh food than I had hoped. The food was overly complicated for the sake of being complicated. Unlike other multi-course gastronomic extravaganzas like those served at the French Laundry (which focuses on amazing ingredients and organic textures), Minibar takes the food out of the art. They leave you with something that looks amazing, is extraordinarily unique, but quite frankly is not real food. Lastly, I barely had to chew the entire evening... Almost, everything was served in a gelatinous, pureed or frozen liquid form. With every course I hoped for something to actually bite into. I had high hopes for Minibar, but Ieft feeling as though the experience was not about eating delicious food and more about being wowed by how ingredients could be technically processed into something else.

Most Michelin star restaurants excel at presentation and taste of the dishes.  I assumed that minibar would be no exception.  The meal started with an amazing presentation and impeccable service, and the flavor was exemplary.  Throughout the rest of the evening, the service and presentation continued at a top tier level, however the food fell flat quickly.  The Caviar/caviar/caviar was expertly presented, however the flavor was bland and uninspired.  Also, this is the first time I have ever left a tasting still hungry by the end of the night.  Credit to the Jose's pairing, the wines were well suited to the dishes, however the dishes were a low water mark, I have had better food at Jaleo.

Came here for my 30th Birthday. If you don't enjoy food and you don't like to try extraordinary deliciousness this is not the place to be. The food experience was superb! It was just that- an experience, I felt like I was in an alternate universe. The portions are small but when you have 25+ bites to eat you leave pretty darn satisfied. If I had money to eat like that weekly, I would. But also it's a special experience for a special occasion and save it just for that! José Andrés is a genius and I will be checking out his other spots!  I have been to barmini and the drinks are also good, dessert as well but the door service there isn't always friendly.
Pricey. SO PRICEY. But worth it!
Delightful meal, service was beyond reproach. Just an excellent evening
I love everything about this place! Perfect couples setting!
A Great experience

Fun but expensive. I keep thinking I could've replaced a washing machine with the price I paid for a ticket that included the tax, tip, drinks, and the meal. Other than that it was a wonderful and fun meal. It is like dinner is the show, it is like being in an interactive art piece. I managed to get an early seating at 5:45 but I did not sit at the bar until after 6. That was fine as I was offered a drink and sat in the waiting room, where they provided a pre-meal snack. I was seated with a party that was celebrating a birthday. The bar when full has room for 12 people then there is that one table so the room is quiet enough to talk to your seatmates. The myriad of dishes are all artistic, in the presentation and the combination of flavors. There is a heavy use of nitrogen in the creation of a lot of dishes and non-alcoholic drinks. It is all very interesting. At the end, I was moved over to the barmini side for dessert. There I was able to marvel at the creativity and showy-ness of that side. I only gave 4 stars because I wish I could give 4.5. I might still be in shock due to the price and I had a far better experience at another 2 Michelin starred DC restaurant.

Definitely very interesting drinks. Had the valentine's Day flight of 6 drinks and it was fun. We also ordered a few nibbles like the grilled cheese, beet tartar and the crisp. The crisp was a big let down but the grilled cheese and the beet tartar were pretty good. It's a must experience if you love cocktails and chemistry! A totally fun experience.

WOW!!!!! Minibar is truly an amazing dining experience.  I was so impressed with the service, the décor, the drinks and wine pairing and the delectable plates.  My boyfriend surprised me with a reservation here to celebrate my birthday and my acceptance into graduate school. It's definitely an experience that you want to reserve for a super special occasion (unless you are loaded) since one could easily spend $500 per person after a wine pairing and tips. My boyfriend had made this reservation about one month in advance, which seems to be the norm. However the couple that sat next to us got lucky and was able to make a reservation about 2 days before.  When you first arrive you are seated in a cozy common area where you will be treated with champagne. When everybody in your seating time has arrived you will be escorted to the table. From the moment you are seated, expect to be surprised and impressed with the highest level of service and most exquisite cuisines.  From there you will embark on this culinary journey. There were so many plates and all of them were amazingly pleasant to the taste buds. My favorites the fish-shaped biscuit made of seaweed and caviar, the sashimi garnished with salmon roe, the kimchee mussel shells, cotton candy cake, the gummy caterpillars, the bourbon peanuts, the krispy kreme donuts. I won't go into detail because the plates just have to be experienced.  Every dish and wine pairing is explained and if you have further questions every body behind your behind will be able to answer any of them. All of them are culinary geniuses.  I know that going to minibar may seem quite pricey, but if you have an appreciation for the culinary arts then I would highly recommend it!
Service is outstanding a great experience

This was spectacular. Every cocktail was creative, well thought out, and special. The service was perfect, and the decor was fantastic. I've run out of synonyms so I'll stop here.  Update, I thought of some more. Amazing! Exciting! Delicious!

An out of this world experience with some of the most whimsical and delicious food. Service was very attentive and watching the chefs create art in front of your eyes was magical. Be sure to make reservations as soon as they release them online. The wine pairings all worked perfectly and everyone was extremely knowledgeable.
Once in a lifetime culinary experience!!!! Menu is re-created all the time.  Great staff!!!
The food, staff, presentation, ambiance and yes - the overall EXPERIENCE was five out of five! Go!
This place is Ok I guessssss
The single most unique dining experience I've ever had. Dishes were whimsical and delicious, blending the boundaries between art and food.
The food was amazing, but the service and the experience really make it worthwhile. Additionally, they are extremely considerate for allergy needs and will tailor their dishes accordingly.

So you call you self a foodie...You're not a foodie unless you break the bank for this culinary experience.  This restaurant crosses ever "T" and dots every "I" in gastronomic magnificence. The seasonal avant-gardee menu will stretch the bounds of your imagination, and tease your palate with the perfect paring for every precious morsel. Go! Go! Go!
Worth every penny.  The experience at the chef's counter was entertaining and educational.
The specialty drinks were amazing. Service fantastic too.
What an experience! The Chef's Table is an incredible way to dine. Reservations are very tough to get. Good luck!

I love every single Jose Andres restaurant I've been to except this one. The culinary tricks are cool at first, but then they do the same ones over and over again, and ultimately they're just that, tricks. No wonder why Washingtonian magazine says this:  "Many dishes in the lineup these days are more about brow-raising wizardry than deliciousness—get ready for a lot of gelatinous textures—and the whole production feels more rushed than it has in years past."  Washingtonian in 2015 ranked Minibar #2 in DC, which is why we went there, but after my experience, I wasn't surprised to see it ranked #22 in 2016.  If it cost $100 bucks, I'd feel a lot differently about it, but at $400, I'm not a happy camper. Go to Komi instead.

Minibar was a great experience.  We reserved Jose's table which is a semi-private table which seats 4 and includes elevated drink pairings.  The experience starts when you arrive and are seated for a cocktail in barmini.  Once led into the room for seating at Jose's table you are brought drinks and the first course.  The night we went we had 26 courses with 8 different wine pairings.  I enjoyed all the courses and wine choices as well.  What I noticed was each course had very specific ingredients which you could taste separately from each other and at different times while chewing.  The flavors are not all muddled together.  After dinner we moved over to Barmini for drinks to finish out the evening.  We arrived at 7:10pm and left at 1:30am, so almost 6.5 hours in total.  it's expensive but worth it for the unique food and experience.

Before I went to Mini Bar, I actually delivered many types of fresh produce from my father's local farm. I was very skeptical when invited to a dinner by the head chef, but my father insisted.  I was greeted by a warm, flower scented towel; a great relief after walking many blocks from a difficult parking spot to find in DC. We were formally sat down and a few minutes later started the dinner. But here's the thing, It really wasn't a dinner,it was more of an experience. An experience of an incredible amount of detail and flavors. From food trickery and an edible muscle shell, to a frozen chocolate puck being served to you by hand, it wasn't at all a meal.  Although I did not feel full at all after partaking in all of the many, many portions, I did feel that I tried some of the most interesting food I have had in a long time. The one thing I could suggest is a main dish that I could actually take a few bites out of. The menu constantly changes and this is a good thing. For around $200 you are paying for an experience like no other that you would find in DC.

Stumbled into this restaurant almost  on accident due to the amazing smells emanating from inside with my mother and two girls. Environment was very high end and the cost of the dishes was surprisingly affordable...
The best 4.5 hour culinary experience!
A culinary gem. Delivers novelty, taste and experience with exceptional style.  The bar is a true bartender's bar. Thanks for tilting the country's culinary center of gravity toward DC.

Not just dining, but performance art! Our table chef, Alex (you'll know him by his amazing menu sleeve tattoo) was a maestro in the kitchen. Conducting a handful of sous chefs in what could only be called a symphony of culinary timing. To say everything tasted, looked, and was presented perfectly would be to do Jose's staff a disservice. This meal went beyond exceptional. We ordered the Celebration pairing, a nightlong endless experience of bubbly, custom paired to each of the 26ish courses with absolute attention to detail by the most lovely sommelier, Melissa. She not only paired the perfect champagne and sparkling wine for each course, she also took great care to describe perfectly how it would pair, what region the bubbly came from, and how it was made. She had a deep knowledge of food and wine, and it paid off. This was a perfect night. If you're on the fence about spending the money, don't be. It is well worth it.

#nausea #insulting if you ate here and said you enjoyed it, you're pretentious and lying.  You will be nauseous when you leave and immediately try to find another place to get a meal.  You will spend 2 hours and $400 for 7 bites of foamy, runny, gelatinous phlegm.  I implore you to go somewhere else.

Um, yes and yes and yes and yes! So good. Such a beautiful movement like watching artists paint for you! I love this place and the tasting menu and service is impeccable. The non alcoholic cocktail tasting to me is more interesting than the alcoholic one. It's seriously amaze. #dishcrawlapproved

It was an experience I will never forget.  Amazing.  Very difficult reservation to get, but worth it.  Six lucky souls seat at the bar and experience the essence of taste and modern molecular gastronomy.  It is the science and passion of cooking as food and taste burst in your palette.  It is something everyone should experience once in their lives and I will remember it forever.  Not your grandmother's cooking.
my absolute favorite.  still innovative after all these years!
yum! not only was the food here great but so was the sangria! the prices weren't too extravagant and the service was great!

absolutely fantastic, some of the best food in dc, and definitely creative, yet balanced with traditional dishes.  from the cotton-candy "magic" mojito to the table-side (unbelievable) guacamole, atlantico runs the gamut from the traditional dishes well-done to creative and innovative takes.
it is special, but actually the smallness takes away from the collective fun it would be in a bigger locale. the food was fun to look at and even more fun to eat.
